metadata.author: Panaderia Libre
metadata.description: A hearty sourdough bread enriched with black walnuts, dried cranberries, and olive oil for a robust flavor profile.

contains: Seeds (if using inclusions like sunflower or pumpkin seeds)
allergens.notes: Ensure inclusions are sourced from allergen-safe facilities if needed.

making: Combine the flour, water, sourdough starter, and olive oil in a large mixing bowl. Let it rest for 30 minutes (autolyse).
Add salt to the mixture and knead until smooth.
Perform 3-4 sets of stretch-and-folds every 30 minutes during the bulk fermentation (about 4 hours at room temperature).
Gently fold in the cranberries and black walnuts during the final stretch-and-fold.
Shape the dough as needed (e.g., loaf, boule) and place it in a floured proofing basket or on a tray.
Cover and cold-proof in the refrigerator overnight (8-12 hours).
Preheat the oven to 250°C (480°F) with a Dutch oven or baking stone inside.
Transfer the dough to the preheated surface, score the top, and bake for 20 minutes with steam.
Reduce the oven temperature to 230°C (450°F) and bake for another 20-25 minutes until golden brown.
storage: Store the bread in a paper bag at room temperature for up to 2 days.
For longer storage, wrap tightly in plastic or foil and freeze for up to 1 month.
reheating: To refresh, heat in an oven at 180°C (350°F) for 10-15 minutes.
For slices, toast in a toaster or under a broiler until warmed.
usage: Best served with butter or olive oil as a side to soups and salads.
Makes excellent sandwiches, especially for grilled cheese or paninis.
Use stale bread for croutons, breadcrumbs, or bread pudding.
